meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Saudi Arabia.
meanings.sent1: In Saudi Arabia, you can buy many things with just a few qurush.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for qurush at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The vending machine only accepted qurush, so I had to find a currency exchange.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a handful of shiny qurush, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the qurush jingling in his pocket was music to his ears.

meanings.definition: A coin worth five piastres in Egypt.
meanings.sent1: She found a qurush on the sidewalk and picked it up for good luck.
meanings.sent2: The shopkeeper gave me a qurush in change for my purchase.
meanings.sent3: The qurush rolled away, causing a comical chase down the street.
meanings.sent4: The qurush gleamed in the sunlight, a tiny treasure in her palm.
meanings.sent5: He flipped the qurush in the air, catching it skillfully in his hand.

meanings.definition: A former unit of currency in Turkey.
meanings.sent1: My grandfather used to tell stories about the old days when they used qurush in Turkey.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed ancient qurush coins from the Ottoman Empire.
meanings.sent3: The children played pretend market, trading colorful leaves as qurush.
meanings.sent4: The memories of the qurush era lingered in the old town's architecture.
meanings.sent5: The antique shop owner offered a rare qurush for sale to collectors.
